reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cutter Cuts a Wide Path
reviews.reviewText: With Arliss Cutter, Marc Cameron gives us a character with personal integrity who unapologetically follows the rules and regulations—AND still manages to cut a wide path. Personally, I’m tired of the loose-cannon, corner-cutting cops who buck the system. OPEN CARRY is a refreshing, respectable read. It has an interesting plot that openly carries the reader quickly from one page to the next. It is the perfect bedtime book for our current sub-zero nights.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well Written and a definite page-turner
reviews.reviewText: Like many suspense novels, the ending was not very believable but enjoyed it anyway. Moving on to the next Arlie’s Cutter Novel!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have read the second book in this series already so I wanted to go back and start at the beginning before I continued on. This is a very good beginning to the Arliss Cutter series. We get to know US Marshall Cutter, his deceased brother’s wife and kids, whom he is helping out, and many other characters that he works with. He has many life rules he follows, learned from his grandfather “Grumpy.” I sure wish we could have met him as well, but I feel like I know him because Arliss thinks of him often.I fluctuated between 3 and 4 stars while reading this because it bogged down a little in the middle of the book. However, the last third of the book had me quickly turning the pages. Because of that and knowing how good the second book is, I have bumped it up to 4 stars. I’m anxious to keep on reading these for the mystery that plays out among the beautiful terrain of Alaska, be it land or sea.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Law Enforcement at its very best!
reviews.reviewText: Marc Cameron is one skilled author when it comes to the police drama investigation drama. He has been able to create realistic Alaska State Troopers, US Deputy Marshall’s, and local law enforcement officers. The real miracle is they managed to (mostly) get all fairly well, and cooperate on the numerous active cases that were thrown their way. With the wild Alaska wilderness as a backdrop, there was nonstop action and thrills!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Stretched my Suspension of disbelief
reviews.reviewText: The action was fun. The characters were interesting. Most of the unlikely stuff I enjoyed despite the necessity to dust off my Suspension of disbelief.The story left out details necessary to understand how we got from here to there. For example, how did two Mexican thugs unfamiliar with Alaska or even knowing the people they were chasing find them in a remote cabin without making themselves noticeable to all the people in a small Alaskan village.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great crime mystery series, set in Alaska
reviews.reviewText: My husband and I just finished the Arliss Cutter books, through book 5. Mr. Cameron weaves his stories together well. Great character development. The descriptions of life in bush Alaska are really, really good, from dog sledding to train trips. And there are recipes! Can't give away more. Glad we found Marc Cameron, looking forward to more about Arliss, Lola and the rest.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good read and interesting characters
reviews.reviewText: Not a lot of gunfights or slug-outs here if you are looking for non-stop violence, but if you want that stuff added in as a spice to the overall book, then you will be satisfied. Cutter is an old fashioned sort of guy but not in a dumb way or sexist way. He is just veiled in his emotions, but when he lets loose on a really bad guy, watch out! The opening scene is crazy!There are also some of those scenes where he sets right some young punk being a smart ass, and I always find those fun.Not a lot of mystery here. You get chapters of Cutter and his people working and you get chapters of the bad guys being bad. Of course they converge at the end.I like the characters here and enjoyed watching them in action and interacting with one another. I would say give it a try. I think the people and their motivations in here are more complex than the people in a Reacher book. I also like the way the author does not use the worn out BS of the noble guy who is faithful to the memory of his one true love......... until a bikini walks by.Good characters, good dialogue, action, a bit of violence here and there.... Give it a try!

I love the Arliss Cutter character. I especially enjoy the interactions between he and his partner Lola and how they seem to always be in step. I couldn’t wait to find out the next step in each chapter and although upset the next chapter wasn’t always a continuation, by the time I was through that, I couldn’t wait for it’s continuation. Always a roller coaster ride, navigating through each chapter. After reading the book, it made me want to pay a visit to wild, mostly uninhabited Alaska! I want to meet its peoples and learn more about its heritage. The story was quite unique and as the title to my review says…I couldn’t put it down! Give me more Arliss & Lola please, Marc Cameron.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Great, I've found another character I like!
reviews.reviewText: I generally like Marc Cameron's writing (except the few "Tom Clancy" books) and thoroughly enjoyed the Jericho Quinn series so was glad to give this a go. Please I did as the book was absorbing, detailed and riveting. The main character was well described and believable and so were the others, some quirky and enjoyable. Great read and I am looking forward to the next.

... ein blasser US Marshal Arliss Cutter, der lieber Suppe kocht als auf Mörderjagd geht. Dazu eine etwas strange anmutende Beziehung zu der Frau seines verstorbenen Bruders und seiner Kollegin Lola, die ihrerseits eine etwas strange anmutende Beziehung zu ihrem Mann, dann Ex-Mann unterhält. Mmmh.Die Dialoge sind langweilig, ohne Esprit und Creativität. Die Story dümpelt vor sich hin, nimmt nie richtig Fahrt auf, obwohl sie in einer der atemberaubensten Landschaften der Welt spielt, in der ein flüchtiger Kidnapper Unterschlupf bei einer Film Crew findet, ein Cartel Drogenboss der übelsten Sorte sein Unwesen treibt und natürlich, ein Storm im Anmarsch ist. Aber Arliss Cutter kocht Suppe oder schnitzt, weil er nachdenken muss.Dem Plot fehlt das Leben, die Identifikation mit seinen Helden, die Schärfe der Charactere, die Action und der big final shoot-out. So sind es beschriebene Seiten, mehr nicht.Schade. Schade. Schade.Auch wenn das jetzt kein pageturner ist, gebe ich Arliss Cutter noch eine Chance. Vielleicht überrascht er mich, vielleicht auch nicht. You never know.
Another good read by Marc Cameron. Alaska is a fine canvas for a crime fighter to be based in. Worth the read.
